pr_title: Do not accept HTTP urls in Https connection constructor

timeline.message: Do not accept HTTP urls in Https connection constructor
Fix the unit test to catch the correct exception

timeline.bodyText: Since this test method now checks that the constructor throws, you can rename this test method
timeline.author: timtay-microsoft

replies.bodyText: I totally spaced out on the name ! sure thing
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.message: Reanaame the test to better represent the actual expectation

timeline.bodyText: If we make this change we need to let PM know before drop it off. lets chat about this
timeline.author: prmathur-microsoft

replies.bodyText: The method signature doesn't change and if someone uses http instead of https, the SSL context will throw an exception. so I don't think there is a behavior change. The exception we throw will be slightly different though.
replies.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: I took a look through the code, and there are no instances where the SDK would ever pass "http" instead of "https", so there is no impact on our customers here. We aren't taking away http support because we never had http support
replies.author: timtay-microsoft
